main event: Two objects spotted in the sky over Pontiac, Michigan, on 15 February 1956.
interesting points: The objects were red, orange, white, and blue., The objects were at approximately 5,000 feet and heading south at a slow speed., The sighting lasted about ten minutes and the objects were still in sight when reported., The sky was overcast with scattered snow showers at the time of the sighting., The observation concluded that the sighting might have been balloons based on wind conditions.
